documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: thanks for joining us as we come to the end of another week on bbc local live : northamptonshire .
we return on tuesday with regular updates .

have a great bank holiday weekend , and do n't forget you can tune in to bbc radio northampton 's live commentary from franklin 's gardens for the saints v stade francais clash , which is one of the many things you can read about if you scroll down this page
author: Kris Holland
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: weekend weather : hot and humid
text: it 's set to be a beautiful evening across the bbc east region , with fine and dry weather and clear skies , though it could feel muggy overnight .
some sea mist and fog may move in along the norfolk coast for a few hours .
tomorrow is going to be another dry and sunny one , feeling hot and humid .
cloud will increase from the west and bring the risk of a few isolated heavy showers or thunderstorms during the afternoon , although many places will remain completely dry .
moderate southeasterly winds , becoming light southwesterly by the end of the day .
highs of 28c ( 82f ) .
author: Chris Bell
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: teaching assistant jailed for child sex offences
text: a former teaching assistant at a school in corby has been jailed for three years after admitting 15 sexual offences against children as young as 13 .
northampton crown court heard that stuart baker , 40 , who used to work at corby business academy , used a fake facebook profile to pose as a 14-year-old girl and befriend teenage boys .
he persuaded five of them to send him explicit photos of themselves over a period of about 18 months .
baker had previously pleaded guilty to 10 charges of inciting children to engage in sexual activity and a further five relating to the making and distribution of indecent images of children .
judge timothy smith said : `` a significant amount of planning had gone into this deception .
you exploited these boys .
this was a breach of trust as a high level teaching assistant . ''
the court was told that it had caused his victims psychological harm .
baker was also banned from working with children and put on the sex offenders register indefinitely .
author: Stuart Bailey
BBC News

documents.title: trespassing raccoon 'friendly and inquisitive '
text: a raccoon , which was found in a house in northampton after getting in through the cat flap earlier this month , is settling in to his new rspca home .
the animal charity believes he was an abandoned pet and it has produced a video of him at its stapeley grange centre in cheshire which you can watch by clicking here .
the charity said he will be rehoused in a more specialised facilities once he is neutered and vaccinated .
lee stewart , stapeley grange manager , said : `` we must stress that raccoons really do n't make good pets .
`` they are wild animals and we would strongly discourage people from buying or keeping one .
`` they are nocturnal and need a great deal of space so their needs can not be met in a ty domestic environment . ''

documents.title: game 'slipping away ' from northantsworcestershire 76-0 ( 14.1 overs ) v northamptonshire 238
text: it 's not an exaggeration to say that this game is already slipping away from northamptonshire .
a poor effort with the bat has been followed by a moderate start with the ball and worcestershire have rattled along at five-and-a-half an over .
there is definitely a bit of swing available but northants have n't found a good enough area so far to create any opportunties .
worcestershire will be delighted and have daryl mitchell and brett d'oliveria resuming their alliance that added a mere 243 last time out at derby .
author: Alex Winter
BBC Radio Northampton sport

documents.title: saints v stade : team news as wood returns as captain
text: england back row tom wood returns to captain northampton in the saints ' only change for tonight 's champions cup play-off against stade francais .
the 30-year-old , who missed the play-off semi-final win over connacht with a back injury up against harlequins earlier this month , replaces jamie gibson at open-side flanker .
he is joined in the back row by louis picamoles and teimana harrison .
captain sergio parisse will miss the match for stade francais .
however , the french team are strengthened by the return of australian scrum-half will genia .
france international jules plisson is preferred to springbok rival morne steyn at fly-half , while prop rabah slimani is on the bench .
south african jonathan ross , who will join sale at the start of next season , comes in to replace parisse at number eight .
victory will assure northampton of a ninth successive season of top-flight european rugby .
saints finished bottom of their pool , behind leinster , montpellier and castres this campaign .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: cobblers ' wembley win remembered in special programme
text: wednesday marked 20 years since northampton town football club beat swansea city 1-0 in the division three ( now league two ) play-off final .
john frain 's 93rd minute free-kick helped the cobblers cap their centenary season with promotion in front of over 32,000 of their supporters under wembley 's twin towers .
tonight from 18:00 , bbc radio northampton presents a special programme with memories of the day from former manager ian atkins and captain ray warburton .
several of the players , including frain , will also feature on the show , along with the bbc radio northampton commentators that day , mike sewell and tim oglethorpe .

documents.title: northampton saints prepare for champions cup showdown
text: northampton saints are in the second chance saloon as they take on french club stade francais in the european rugby champions cup play-off final at franklin 's gardens tonight .
both clubs missed out on automatic qualification after they finished outside the top six in their respective domestic leagues .
saints finished the premiership season in seventh , and beat irish club connacht 21-15 in saturday 's play-off semi-final .
`` we 've got one more game now and it 's going to be difficult , '' said saints director of rugby jim mallinder .
`` we know where we are at .
this is it .
it 's a big game , against a big team and they have got some class acts .
but so have we - and the players are really looking forward to that competition . ''

the green , black & gold - european champions in 2000 - have competed in eight successive seasons of top-flight european rugby , but finished bottom of their pool , behind leinster , montpellier and castres this campaign .
there will be increased security at franklin 's gardens after the terrorist attack at manchester arena on monday .
this was the scene at the gardens earlier this afternoon , bathed in sunshine
radio northampton has full commentary of the match , which kicks-off at 19:45 , with build-up from 19:00 available here ( uk only ) .
well lads.its ours for the taking # heart.pride.passion # supporters do your usual make the noise # c.o.y.s #
have you got one of those framed shirts made for @ twitterid yet ?
mint
author: Graham McKechnie
BBC Radio Northampton sport

documents.title: northants 'have n't helped themselves'northamptonshire 216-8 v worcestershire ( 58.5 overs )
text: there has been a bit in this wicket for the bowlers and worcestershire were probably right to think their best chance of getting something out of it was to bowl first , but northants have not helped themselves with a series of cheap dismissals .
you would expect worcestershire to bat with more care - but you would also expect the northants bowlers to go well with a first-choice attack back fit here .

they would have liked a few more to bowl at than this but graeme white and nathan buck have at least brought up a batting point with a half-century stand - the first of the innings - for the ninth wicket .
author: Alex Winter
BBC Radio Northampton sport

documents.title: manchester attack : wellingborough to hold vigil for victims
text: a vigil for the victims of the manchester bombing will be held in wellingborough tonight .
the event has been organised by the town 's inter faith group , and take place from 18:00 in the town centre , opposite the hind hotel on sheep street .
the organisers say they 're keen to invite people of all faiths and none to come together to show solidarity with those suffering in manchester .
mohiuddin choudhury , from the shahjalal jame masjid mosque , said : `` our thoughts and prayers are with all the victims and their families at this time .
`` this is a horrific and criminal attack on innocent human life .
`` we want the perpetrators to face the toughest justice of the land and in the thereafter .

`` we pay tribute to our police force , other emergency services ( such as fire services , ambulance services , doctors , and nurses ) and those who played such important roles to save people 's lives and rushed to assist survivors and their families . ''
twenty two people , including a number of children , died in monday 's suicide attack at manchester arena .

documents.title: weather watchers : your view of northamptonshire 's sunshine
text: please do n't hold me accountable if the weather turns over the weekend - but it feels like summer has arrived .
here are some of the best shots of the day from our bbc weather watchers , taken around the county

documents.title: patient 'suffered ' after hospital error

documents.title: 'worcestershire 's decision justified'northants 95-4 ( 29 overs ) v worcestershire
text: a very strange morning here .

glorious weather but worcestershire clearly saw something in the wicket that was enough persuasion to bowl first and by the way the second hour of the morning has played out , they are fully justified .
there has been plenty happening for the bowlers and jack shantry has just got one to leap on richard levi that he edged to slip .
rob keogh also fell to a good delivery from ed barnard and coupled with the poor strokes of max holden and ben duckett , it 's not been the best of starts for northants here .
author: Alex Winter
BBC Radio Northampton sport

documents.title: northamptonshire hosting worcestershire in county championship
text: both sides held a minute 's silence before the match in memory of the victims of monday 's manchester terror attack .
you can listen to live commentary from bbc radio northampton here .
in memory of the victims of mondays horrific attack in manchester , both teams will be wearing black armbands as a symbol of remembrance .

documents.title: 'garry ' on early for worcestershirenorthants 22-1 v worcestershire
text: perfect day for cricket here in northampton in what is a big game between a worcestershire side who have won three from three so far this season and northamptonshire who are two from three - their only defeat was at worcester , and that just by 20 runs .
perhaps surprisingly on such a gorgeous day , worcestershire did not contest the toss and are in the field .
they may think that if there is anything available from what can often be a fairly benign surface at wantage road , it 'll be first thing .
but they 've given a early bowl to australian off-spnner nathan 'garry ' lyon , who is bowling to ben duckett and alex wakely .
author: Alex Winter
BBC Radio Northampton sport

documents.title: police arrest two on sus of murder after fatal crash in northampton
text: yesterday we told you that a northampton man had died , after a collision involving the motorbike he was riding and a car .

stuart hutchings , 22 , of southfields , died at university hospital , coventry on wednesday , having sustained head injuries on eastern avenue north in kingsthorpe - close to the junction with eastern close - at about 20:30 on thursday , 18 may .
now , police say that a 25-year-old man and a 28-year-old man , both from the daventry area , are being questioned by detectives on sus of murder in connection with the collision .
police are continuing to appeal for witnesses who saw the collision or either of the vehicles involved - a white motocross bike and a red ford fiesta .

documents.title: mercedes ' hamilton eighth , vettel quickest , in monaco
text: ferrari 's sebastian vettel set an impressive pace in second practice at the monaco grand prix as lewis hamilton - driving for brackley-based mercedes - ended the session eighth .
championship leader vettel was 0.487 seconds quicker than red bull 's daniel ricciardo , with stevenage 's hamilton more than a second off the pace .
hamilton was top in the first session , but mercedes were less competitive later , a concern for the weekend .
final practice and qualifying in monte carlo takes place from 09:55 on saturday , with the race at 13:00 on sunday .
as ever , there 'll be full coverage available on the bbc sport website .
author: Andrew Benson
Chief F1 writer in Bahrain

documents.title: survey commissioned for northampton castle site
text: archaeologists are trying to establish where northampton castle was built , after northampton borough council commissioned a survey of the site .
built in the 11th century , the castle was situated on part of the current train station site and parliament sometimes sat there between 1131 and 1380 .
the english civil war ( 1642-1651 ) and a fire left it largely derelict by the end of the 17th century , before part of the site was bought by london & north west railway in 1852 .
experts believe many of the remains were destroyed over time as the railway developed .

an area presumed to encompass the north gate and part of the northern barbican ( the outer defence - often a double tower above a gate or drawbridge ) was surveyed by technicians from the museum of london archaeology ( mola ) at the beginning of the week .
`` the events that took place there will always be an important part of our history , so it 's wonderful to have a chance to explore that heritage further . ''
said councillor tim hadland .
`` the results of the survey should provide us with a rough map of what may still lie beneath the surface .
`` this will be very valuable for interpreting the layout of the castle for future generations . ''
the work is being undertaken in tandem with the friends of northampton castle .
dr marie dickie , chairwoman of the friends group , said it was important that places do n't lose touch with their history .
`` it was hugely important , '' she said .
`` it was one of the castles that the barons , when they were at war with king john , were deeply determined to keep for themselves .
`` they knew that , if they had northampton castle , they could keep the king under control .
it was of big national significance . ''
it 's hoped that the survey will outline the castle 's footprint , with plans to help visualise how it may have looked .
author: Willy Gilder
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: kettering general hospital 'fiddled ' waiting time records
text: thousands of patients were removed from a hospital 's waiting lists in a bid to `` fiddle '' the system , it has been claimed .

david phelan , a hospital trust governor , said it was `` apparent '' to him that `` a systematic fiddling of the waiting list figures was taking place , '' and claims patients were removed from lists because national targets were being missed .
the hospital admits there had been `` anomalies '' and that a thorough review of data had been carried out .
author: Matt Precey
BBC Look East

documents.title: weather : sunny and warm
text: it is going to be another sunny and warm day across northamptonshire .
there 's a possibility of some more cloud around this afternoon , but staying dry .
the expected high is 24c ( 75f ) .
get the full forecast where you are , from bbc weather .

documents.title: northampton boxer weighs in ahead of professional debut
text: last week we told you how a female boxer from northampton had turned professional with boxing promoter and former world champion barry mcguigan .

chantelle cameron , 26 , got into the sport at a club in far cotton having also taken part in kickboxing and thai boxing and had enjoyed a successful career as an amateur , narrowly missing out on qualification for the 2016 olympic games in rio .
she makes her professional debut tonight at cardiff arena against poland 's kristina polovikin , and as this video shows , she 's just completed the weigh-in for the lightweight division bout

the women 's bout is on the undercard - the main attraction is the vacant british cruiserweight title fight featuring cardiff 's undefeated craig kennedy and blackpool 's former british and commonwealth title challenger matty askin .
weights for @ twitterid vs. karina kopinska cameron : 9st 7lbs 7oz kopinska : 9st 7lbs chantelle makes her pro debut tomorrow night !
is n't this who @ twitterid annihilated in her pro debut too ?
only one winner
would n't fancy going home to one of them short in the house keeping ; ) good luck chantelle
author: Caroline Densley
BBC Radio Northampton sport

we 'll be here until 18:00 keeping you up-to-date with the latest news , sport , weather and travel as it happens .

documents.title: goering cigar box sells for £ 3,200
text: goering cigar box sells for £ 3,200

documents.title: plans to renovate historic house near corby
text: plans have been submitted to renovate one of corby 's most historic houses .
east carlton hall , a grade ii listed building , was built in 1870 in the style of a french chateau .
originally a home to the palmer family , it was later owned by the stewarts and lloyds steel makers .
it sits alongside east carlton country park .
the current owner , dutch company lhm rotterdam , says that over the years rain has penetrated the building , damaging the roof , internal ceilings , floors and walls .
urgent repairs are required to prevent further decay , and an application has now been to submitted to corby borough council to undertake the work .
the owners say that otherwise there will be further damage and deterioration .
author: Martin Borley
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: manchester attack : video as northamptonshire pauses for victims
text: at 11:00 , people across the united kingdom - including here in northamptonshire - paused for a minute 's silence to remember the victims of monday 's manchester terror attack .
radio northampton reporters were in corby , daventry and northampton as the community came together

documents.title: cigar box owned by nazi leader sells for £ 3,200 at auction
text: a silver cigar box that belonged to nazi leader hermann goering has sold at auction for £ 3,200 - roughly three times more than its catalogue estimate of £ 800-1200 .
the item was bought by an anonymous phone bidder at jp humbert auctioneers in whittlebury as part of an `` international militaria auction '' .

the box was given to goering for his 50th birthday in 1943 by german field marshall milch whose father was jewish and thereby lived in goring 's `` protection '' from persecution by the german state .
`` these results show the continued fascination with high-ranking members of the nazi party and the excesses they indulged in , '' said auctioneer jonathan humbert .
`` many of these items have now been purchased by museums and private collectors and will continue to both fascinate and revile people in equal measure . ''
seven other goering-related items also sold well above their estimates , totalling £ 9,300 .

these included a large silver bowl presented to goering by the german hunting association for £ 2,220 , a silver desk set for £ 1,000 and an ivory letter opener given to goering by the japanese government c.1943 which sold for £ 680 .
goering committed suicide while awaiting execution for crimes against humanity following the nuremburg trials after world war two .

documents.title: local papers round-up : college complain to ofsted , improved rating for ngh , kettering town centre wins award
text: here 's a look at what else is making the news around northamptonshire :

documents.title: northampton man , 22 , dies a week after motorbike crash
text: a 22-year-old man from northampton has died after a collision involving the motorbike he was riding and a car , police have confirmed .

stuart hutchings , 22 , of southfields , died at university hospital , coventry yesterday , as a result of head injuries sustained in the collision which happened in eastern avenue north , kingsthorpe , close to the junction with eastern close .
police say mr hutchings ' white motocross bike collided with a red ford fiesta at about 20:30 on thursday , 18 may .
the two occupants of the ford fiesta were uninjured .
police are appealing for witnesses who saw the collision or either of the vehicles involved prior to it .

documents.title: two road accidents cause delays for motorists
text: we 've just received more information about two serious road accidents in cambridgeshire .
police say the a141 by raf wyton should reopen shortly after an accident between a motorbike and a car .
a woman has been airlifted to addenbrooke 's hospital with serious injuries .
there are also still long delays on the a1 northbound at wittering after the police were called at about 12:05 to an accident involving two vehicles .
the east of england ambulance service says three patients were taken to peterborough city hospital with minor injuries .
the road remains partially blocked .
traffic released # a1 northbound btwn # a47 and b1081 # wittering .
1 lane remains closed while @ twitterid deal with a collision .
long delays
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: formula 1 : hamilton fastest in monaco gp first practice
text: stevenage 's lewis hamilton headed title rival sebastian vettel in first practice at the monaco grand prix as jenson button finished 14th on his return to f1 .
hamilton , who drives for brackley-based mercedes , led vettel 's ferrari by 0.196 seconds as red bull 's max verstappen took third from the second mercedes of valtteri bottas .
hamilton spent the first part of the session swapping fastest times with bottas , but edged clear by 0.366 seconds .
second practice in monte carlo is under way , and you can follow live text coverage here .
author: Andrew Benson
Chief F1 writer in Monaco

documents.title: on this day : saints lose 2013 premiership final
text: it 's four years to the day since northampton saints contested rugby union 's aviva premiership final for the first time .
the saints - who had their captain dylan hartley sent off for using abusive language - lost 37-17 to rivals leicester tigers at twickenham on saturday , 25 may , 2013
there was a happier ending for saints in the 2014 final , though , as they beat saracens 24-20 to become english champions for the first time .

documents.title: saints name team to face stade in european play-off final
text: northampton saints have made one change to their side ahead of tomorrow 's european champions cup play-off final against stade francais at franklin 's gardens .
tom wood , who started on the bench in saturday 's 21-15 semi-final win over connacht , returns to the starting xv as captain , with jamie gibson dropping to the bench .
if saints win , they will secure a place in european rugby 's top-tier competition for a ninth consecutive season ; if they lose they will play in the european challenge cup instead .

documents.title: northampton chamber to mark centenary
text: northamptonshire 's chamber of commerce celebrates its centenary this month .
the organisation was set up in 1917 by a group of local boot and shoe manufacturers who were concerned about the effects of world war one on their export trade .
today , it represents around 1,000 northamptonshire businesses - who employ over one third of the county 's workforce , making it the largest business support agency in the county .

describing what the chamber does , chief executive paul griffiths said : `` it 's based a lot around small businesses - 90 % of businesses in northamptonshire employ 10 or less people and 80 % are sole traders .
`` we have a lot of creative industries , the high performance technology , food and drink and financial services - so key players . ''
the chamber , which says it is the 10th biggest of its kind in the country , is part of a worldwide network of similar organisations .

`` this is the fourth day , and we 're highlighting what the chamber is about , '' added griffiths , outlining plans to mark the centenary with events over the next 100 working days ( monday-friday ) .

`` it will culminate on the hundredth day at our annual general meeting ( agm ) , which will be happening at the guildhall in northampton on the exact hundredth anniversary of the very first agm in the same building on 10 october . ''

documents.title: manchester attack : silence observed in northamptonshire
text: a national minute 's silence has been held as a mark of respect to the victims of the manchester terror attack .
this was the scene at northampton college
people also gathered in the courtyard at northampton 's guildhall , with father oliver coss , the rector of all saints church , among those in attendance
meanwhile , simon edens , the chief constable of northamptonshire police shared these images on twitter :
we were joined here at our hq by staff & students @ twitterid to stand in silence for manchester .
# westandtogether # ourcommunities

documents.title: manchester attack : uk to observe minute of silence
text: at 11:00 the uk will fall silent to remember the victims of the manchester terror attack .
as a mark of respect we 're pausing our live stream at that time .

documents.title: opening hours cut at troubled northampton pub
text: you may remember last week we told you about a northampton pub which was having its licence reviewed after a series of offences .

between 30 september and 5 february , there were 19 reported thefts or acts of violence at the bantam on abington square - which was open on friday and saturday nights until 06:00 the following morning .
now , a hearing has now taken place and the licensing sub-committee on northampton borough council has brought the bantam 's closing time forward .
it means the pub must close at the earlier time of 05:00 , with patrons unable to enter the pub on thursday , friday and saturday after 02:30 the next day .
new recommendations also state that the pub must maintain its cctv cameras as well as have a mimimum of three door supervisors on duty at all times .
the police were calling for changes to be made after a man was stabbed there on 1 april .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: manchester attack : extra security for saints ' european play-off final
text: northampton saints will have extra security measures in place for their european champions cup play-off final with french club stade francais tomorrow night ( 19:45 kick off ) .
it follows the terrorist attack in manchester on monday .
the club say that fans should allow extra time to get into franklin 's gardens and be prepared for queues .
bags will be searched at the turnstiles and supporters wearing jackets will be asked to unzip them coming into the stadium .
`` we put safety and security of our supporters and staff at the heart of our operations , '' said andy tresias , stadium manager .
`` we have been in dialogue with the police and counter-terrorism officers .
we have plans that have been in place for a number of years and we 've tweaked them a little bit to reassure everyone and increase safety where we need to . ''

there will also be additional patrols of security personnel outside the stadium , while stewards will manage entrances into car parks throughout the game , as well as having additional stewarding at exit points after the game .

saints won their semi-final against irish side connacht 21-15 on saturday , and will earn a place in next seasons champions cup - the top tier european rugby union competition - with another win tomorrow against stade .

documents.title: crick prepares for annual boat show
text: it 's the crick boat show this bank holiday weekend , with events on from 27-29 may .

tens of thousands of visitors are expected and , with the bbc weather forecasting a mix of sun and occasional showers , there 's a chance to find out more about a much-loved lifestyle , or for boat owners to catch up with friends .
so if you want to spend hundreds of thousands of pounds on a new boat , or just enjoy a pint in the sunshine , it could be worth heading down .
`` it 's the history , the nature and the serenity , '' said show director peter johns when i asked what makes canals so idyllic .
`` the canals were really what drove the industrial revolution 200 years ago , '' he said .
`` now they tend to be almost wildlife havens - they are so peaceful . ''
this weekend 's show will feature dozens of exhibitors , with show boats from some of the country 's biggest manufacturers also on offer .
author: Tom Percival
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: weather : hot , dry and sunny
text: a dry and very warm day , with lots of sunshine .
becoming hot by the afternoon , with temperatures reaching 25c ( 26f ) .
the south easterly wind will keep it slightly cooler on the coast .
weather has a more localised forecast for where you live .

documents.title: good morning northamptonshire
text: welcome to live updates for northamptonshire on thursday , 25 may .
we 'll be here until 18:00 keeping you up-to-date with the latest news , sport , weather and travel as it happens .
it looks like another bright and sunny day here in northampton town centre - we 'll look at the full regional forecast next .
and do n't forget that you can get in touch with the team by email , twitter and facebook .

documents.title: breakingraf wittering postpones parade following manchester attack
text: some news we 've just received from the raf - their parade marking the freedom of the town in stamford tomorrow has been postponed , following the uk terror threat level being raised to `` critical '' .

raf wittering spokesman ed palmer told bbc look east : `` in consultation with lincolnshire police and in line with national police guidelines raf wittering has reluctantly decided to postpone the parade marking the freedom of stamford tomorrow .
`` although we are not aware of any specific threat to stamford or raf wittering , we believe it would be more appropriate to hold the parade at a later date .
`` raf wittering apologises for any disappointment and thanks the people of stamford and the nearby communities for their continuing support . ''

documents.title: goodbye
text: well , that 's it for another day here on the local live news feed for northamptonshire .
the team will be back with more news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on thursday morning .
thanks for following and see you again after a snooze - we 'll be back before you know it !

documents.title: weather : warm and dry
text: this evening will stay fine and dry with sunny spells .
a mild and muggy night with areas of cloud at times overnight .
lows of 12c ( 54f ) .
tomorrow will see another warm and sunny day and it will feel humid .
highs of 24c ( 75f ) .
it will feel fresher on the coasts with temperatures of 17c ( 63f ) .
weather has more local forecasts .

documents.title: daventry hospital apologises as operations moved to northampton general
text: operations that were due to be carried out at danetre hospital in daventry have been relocated to northampton because managers say they 're short of staff .
northampton general hospital sends staff to carry out scheduled operations at danetre hospital like eye or facial surgery .
it says a combination of sickness and vacancies means it does n't have enough staff to perform those procedures safely .
patients are being contacted to arrange to have their treatment carried out at northampton general instead .
the hospital has apologised for the inconvenience and says it does n't know when the situation will be resolved .
managers are keen to stress that outpatient appointments , also run by northampton general , are unaffected .
the inpatient ward , which is operated by a different health trust , will remain open .
patients who have any queries about their treatment can get in touch using the direct dial number on their appointment letter .
author: Martin Heath
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: travel : delays to train services through northampton after signalling fault
text: london midland says commuters can expect delays on train services on the west coast mainline through the county until about 16:30 , following a signalling fault at northampton train station .
here 's what the operator put on twitter a little earlier on :
lines have now re-opened , but london midland says services are `` likely '' to be disrupted over the next 90 minutes or so .
we 'll keep you posted as to whether or not that advice changes .
the fault meant that at one point the only route through the station was just one platform , with `` major congestion north and southbound '' .
signalling system fault at # northampton with trains approaching from both the north & south end of the station at a stand .
more info soon .

documents.title: cobblers fans mark 20 years since 'john frain day '
text: as we mentioned a little earlier , it 's 20 years to the day since northampton town famously won their division three ( now league two ) play-off final at wembley stadium .
a twice-taken john frain free-kick in the 93rd minute of the match was all that could separate the cobblers and swansea city in front of more than 46,000 fans beneath the twin towers .
we 've compiled some memories from people who were there below , including former bbc radio northampton sport editor , mike sewell
if you 've got any memories of following the cobblers at wembley in 1997 , then you can get in touch with us via email , twitter and facebook .
and do n't forget that on friday , bbc radio northampton will host a special hour-long programme at 18:00 looking back on the day and speaking to those involved .
it 's 20 years to the day since @ twitterid play-off final win .
were you at wembley for # johnfrainday ?
more
probably the single greatest moment in over 40 years of supporting them .
without doubt , it remains the stand out moment of my commentary career .
# ntfc # johnfrainday
and brilliant it was too
certainly does i still have a copy of your commentary on our goal on cassette tape
cracking day out .
one of my highlights following the cobblers
hopefully you can finish your career back at radio northampton , best sports editor there in my lifetime .
it 's 20 years to the day since @ twitterid play-off final win .
were you at wembley for # johnfrainday ?
more
i remember getting up ridiculously early to catch the train down and the amazing pre-match atmosphere on wembley way .
such a great day .
still the only football match i have ever been to !
and i remember getting rather drunk when we got home !

documents.title: local news round-up : travellers pitch up in northampton , council leader re-elected and details of daventry arts festival
text: here 's a quick look at what else is making the news around northamptonshire today :

documents.title: cobblers ' wembley win marked with special broadcast
text: it 's 20 years to the day since one of the most memorable moments in the history of northampton town football club .
on saturday , 24 may 1997 , the cobblers - in their centenary year - beat swansea city 1-0 in the division three ( now league two ) play-off final at wembley stadium .
with the game goalless into added time , northampton were awarded a free-kick about 20 yards from goal .
john frain 's effort hit the swans ' defensive wall , and extra-time beckoned .
however , the referee ordered the set-piece to be re-taken due to encroachment by one of the swansea players .
frain stepped forward once again ; the rest , as they say , is history .

to mark the 20th anniversary of the club 's famous day at wembley 's twin towers , bbc radio northampton will host a special hour-long programme at 18:00 on friday looking back on the day and speaking to those involved .
if you 've got any memories of following the cobblers at wembley in 1997 , then do n't forget you can get in touch with us via email , twitter and facebook .
author: Kris Holland
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: county ins & outs 2017
text: county ins & outs 2017

documents.title: extended season plans 'upsetting ' - day
text: extended season plans 'upsetting ' - day

documents.title: manchester attack : eyewitness from northampton describes arena 'panic '
text: a northamptonshire teenager who was at the manchester arena during monday 's suicide attack has been speaking about the confusion and fear following the explosion .
brook page , 17 and from milton malsor near northampton , was at the ariana grande gig with her best friend , sister and sister 's friend 's family .
`` we had just started going up the steps to leave the seated area then there was just this big bang , '' she told bbc radio northampton .
`` there was a moment of complete silence in the arena , then everyone started screaming and running away .
i just grabbed hold of my best friend 's hand . ''
twenty-two people died in the attack and 64 were injured ; 20 are in critical care .
describing what happened next , brook said : `` i was on the opposite side [ of the arena ] to the explosion , people ran to where we were , trying to get away in pure panic .
`` when we got out to where the merchandise stands were , people were saying it was a speaker [ explosion ] .
then we saw a guy with blood pouring over his nose , it was all over the floor .
it could n't have been a speaker .
`` the shock did n't really kick in until i got in the car .
i was with my best friend and she is younger than me , so i just wanted to focus on getting her away , and my sister and her friend who was in absolute hysterics .
`` we just wanted to get as far away as possible before it all sunk in . ''

documents.title: faith groups come together in northampton for manchester attack vigil
text: thousands gathered in manchester 's albert square last night to pay their respects to the 22 people killed and 59 injured in monday 's manchester arena attack .
the scene was replicated around the country as many cities and towns had vigils of their own .
in northampton last night a vigil was held outside all saints church , organised by the town 's inter-faith forum and the committee of northampton mosques .
speaking after the event , father oliver coss , the rector of all saints , said : `` evil has always been present in the world , it is an irrepressible force sometimes .
`` what we have to do as communities is meet that with the thousands of acts of kindness that were very evident in manchester yesterday .
`` it 's a question of what we want - do we continue the cycles of recriminations , or do we attend to making our neighbourhoods better , safer and more peaceful ? ''

documents.title: wednesday 's forecast : lots of sunshine and dry weather
text: there 's lots of sunshine this morning , a bit more in the way of cloud as we head into the afternoon .
temperatures getting up to 23c ( 73f ) but chilly on the east coast , only getting up to 15c ( 59f ) .
author: Georgina Burnett
BBC Weather

documents.title: saints ' prop hill to miss argentina tour through injury
text: northampton saints ' prop paul hill is one of two players forced to withdraw from england 's tour of argentina next month due to injury .
hill ( below ) , who is 22 years old , has an ongoing neck injury and has not recovered in time for the two test tour .
he will remain with saints for his rehabilitation .
harlequins centre joe marchant is the other player ruled out of the tour - he has a soft tissue injury .

england head coach eddie jones will announce his 31-man squad travelling to argentina on monday , 29 may , following saturday 's aviva premiership final and england 's old mutual wealth cup match against the barbarians on sunday .
hill 's northampton saints team-mate dylan hartley will captain jones ' side in south america , after being left out of the lions squad .

documents.title: union criticises park and ride scheme at new county council offices
text: it may be seven months later than planned , but staff are finally starting to move into northamptonshire county council 's new headquarters this week .
the angel square complex was due to be completed in october , with all staff moved in by the end of 2016 .
the existing hq at john dryden house was vacated in march , with some staff told to work in libraries or from home until work was completed .
the council has closed 12 other sites around northampton to centralise its offices at one angel square , which will eventually accommodate 2,000 people .
at a cost of £ 40m , the project has come in £ 13m under the provisional budget set out for the scheme .
`` this project actually saves the taxpayer a huge amount of money , '' the county council 's chief executive , paul blantern , told me .
`` it saves us £ 50m over a 25-year life , but , as of today , because of the cost of this building against the cost of the buildings we 've already got out of , we 're saving £ 36,000 a week . ''
however , there has also been criticism .

the building only has 110 parking spaces , many of which are for office pool cars , so to get people to work the council has had to set up a park and ride scheme from franklin 's gardens over a mile away .
`` we have a lot of low-paid women workers who have childcare duties , '' said penny smith , the northamptonshire branch secretary of trade union unison .
`` the extra half-an-hour the bus ride puts on that impacts on their working day and on their ability to fulfil those childcare duties . ''
the council says it has encouraged staff to car share by setting-up a special app to help employees .
author: Stuart Ratcliffe
BBC Look East

the vigil will take place at 19:30 on the steps of all saints church in northampton and has been organised by father oliver coss from the church , the committee of northampton mosques and the northampton inter-faith forum .

documents.title: saints show support for manchester victims
text: northampton saints ' rugby ground will fall silent for a minute before friday 's match , the club has announced .
they 're urging people to get there early to avoid interrupting the tribute to those who died and were injured in the manchester attack .
kick-off against stade francais is scheduled for 19:45 at franklin 's gardens .
we 'll be having a minute 's silence before ko on friday night to remember those killed in manchester last night .
pls be in your seats early

documents.title: manchester attack : northants police pay tribute to victims and colleagues
text: the head of local policing at northamptonshire police says the thoughts of everyone at the force are with those affected by last night 's terrorist attack in manchester .
at least 22 people have been killed and 59 injured following the attack by a lone suicide bomber at the manchester arena , shortly after 22:30 .
in a statement , supt chris hillery said : `` this was an appalling attack on innocent families and young people enjoying a night out at a concert and our thoughts are with everyone affected .
`` we 'd also like to pay tribute to our colleagues in the emergency services , in particular greater manchester police who have worked through the night in the most challenging of circumstances . ''
meanwhile , the union flag is at half-mast at northampton 's guildhall in tribute to the victims of the attack .

documents.title: staff to thank for improvements at northampton general , says chief-executive
text: the chief executive of northampton general hospital has thanked staff and praised their attitude after it received an improved rating from the care quality commission ( cqc ) .
three years ago , the cqc said emergency care , medical care , surgery and end of life care at the hospital required improvement , but all areas are now rated `` good '' .
sonia swart told bbc radio northampton : `` what we 've tried to do is go down to the shop floor and say to people 'what matters to you today ?
' , 'is your department safe ? '
and 'how can we help you to make things better ?
`` when you come to work we tell staff they have two jobs - to deliver care and to make the care better .
what they [ the cqc ] have seen in our staff is very much that attitude . ''
inspectors visited the hospital on five occasions between january and february to judge if the improvements they recommended had been made .

`` you have to recognise that you have a problem , '' said steve o'brien , the dean of the faculty of health and society at the university of northampton , which works closely with northampton general .
`` they did recognise that there were improvements that were required .
they had a plan , and they 've worked very hard - especially around the leadership agenda - to ensure that they had the right leaders in the right places to address the issues . ''

documents.title: cqc highlights treatment of dementia patients in positive report on northampton general
text: the care quality commission ( cqc ) says its inspectors found `` significant improvement '' at northampton general hospital when they visited earlier this year .
they went to the site on five occasions between 30 january and 17 february to see whether improvements had been made in four core service areas .
they were urgent and emergency care , medical care ( including older people 's care ) , surgery and end of life care .
all these areas were previously rated as `` requires improvement '' , but following the latest visits all are now rated `` good '' .
`` our inspectors found a number of significant improvements , '' the cqc 's chief inspector of hospitals , prof sir mike richards , said .

`` the trust had taken action to meet concerns raised during our inspection in january 2014 , particularly with regard to establishing an inclusive and supportive staff culture with a clear focus on patient safety .
`` staff were friendly and compassionate and patients spoke positively about their care and those caring for them .
effective systems were in place to protect people from harm and inspectors saw a number of areas of outstanding practice . ''

prof richards added that inspectors were most impressed with the care people with dementia and at the end of their lives received , and also noted the leadership team in the emergency department had driven improvements despite increasing attendances .

documents.title: northampton general hospital rated `` good '' by inspectors
text: northampton general hospital has improved across the board , according to the latest report by health inspectors .
the care quality commission ( cqc ) says the hospital is now rated `` good '' , after making significant improvements since its last inspection three years ago .
in 2014 , the care quality commission said emergency care , medical care , surgery and end of life care at northampton general all needed to improve .
today , it says they all have done - and are all now rated as `` good '' , with staff at the hospital described as `` caring and compassionate '' .
patients were `` positive '' about their care and leadership at a & e is described as outstanding .
it 's not all perfect - but inspectors say the hospital knows where it still needs to improve and has a plan in place to do so .
ngh was on black alert when the cqc visited in january and february and the inspectors liked what they saw , despite the hospital being at its absolute busiest .
author: Tom Percival
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: cobblers ' new signing 'has potential to be fans ' favourite '
text: northampton town manager justin edinburgh says new signing sam foley has the potential to be a fans ' favourite .
the midfielder , who has signed a two-year-contract effective from 1 july , began his career at newport county before moving to yeovil town , and then port vale in 2015 .
edinburgh said of the 30 year old : `` sam is an attacking box to box midfielder who gets around the pitch well and has a fantastic attitude

`` he has been one of the stand out players for port vale over the last two seasons and he has desire , commitment and the willingness to go through the pain barrier for the cause and they are fantastic qualities for a midfield player to have .
`` with his attributes he is the sort of player who can be a fans ' favourite .

we have worked hard to bring him in , and whilst we have had to be patient to fight off other interest , as well as a new contract offer at port vale , we feel we have sold the club to him well and are delighted he is joining us . ''
author: Caroline Densley
BBC Radio Northampton sport

documents.title: northampton sign foley from port vale
text: northampton sign foley from port vale

documents.title: men who died on a605 near peterborough named
text: two men who died in a collision on the a605 at elton earlier this month have been named .
justinas vosylius and algirdas pelegrimas , both 20 and from louise road in northampton , died when the blue vauxhall corsa they were both passengers in collided with a blue ford focus .
the crash happened around 02:00 on 7 may .
a woman who was also in the corsa was taken to addenbrooke 's hospital with serious injuries .
the driver of the ford , a man in his 50s , suffered minor injuries .
a 19-year-old man who was arrested on sus of two counts of death by dangerous driving and one count of serious injury by dangerous driving has been bailed until 1 august .
author: Adam Jinkerson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'superhero cops ' get back to reality
text: spider-man and his chums have hailed a twitter campaign raising awareness of child sexual exploitation a success worthy of superheroes .
pc rob stevens of northamptonshire police asked colleagues to change their profile and use the hashtag # superhero17 for one week .
hundreds were more than happy to oblige , as pc stevens became spider-man and his boss chief constable simon edens decided a lego batgirl best represented him .

it was the neighbourhood policing officer 's third social media campaign to raise awareness of issues surrounding the sexual exploitation of children , and this year his hashtag campaign `` reached more than a million people '' , he said .
but it was n't just police officers and forces ( like norfolk police , above ) who joined in .
`` it 's good to see survivors of cse ( child sexual exploitation ) getting involved as well this year , '' pc stevens said .
`` it 's the third year i 've done this and definitely more people are talking about it .
it 's important to see that survivors feel able to join in and say something . ''
the campaign officially finished at midday on sunday , but quite a few police officers have held on to their superhero alter-egos .
we 're sure they 'll be back to their normal selves soon , though .

pc stevens said although it was `` very tiring and hard work '' being a superhero and running his campaign while doing a full-time job , he 's already planning # superhero18 which will run again next year .
as # superhero17 comes to a close , i want to say a huge thanks & well done to @ twitterid for helping us all raise awareness of # cse .
and of course @ twitterid we are already looking forward to # superhero18 !
author: Helen Burchell
BBC News

documents.title: staff begin move to new northamptonshire county council offices
text: staff are starting to move into northamptonshire county council 's new headquarters today - seven months later than planned .
the angel square complex was due to be completed in october , with all staff moved in by the end of 2016 .
the existing hq at john dryden house was vacated in march , with some staff told to 'work in libraries ' or from home until work was completed .
the council has closed 12 other sites around northampton to centralise its offices at one angel square , which will eventually accommodate 2,000 people .

documents.title: police arrest three after 'sus fire in desborough
text: a fire in an outbuilding at a property in desborough last night is being treated as sus police say .
three men have been arrested in connection with the incident and remain in police custody .
six fire crews , including two from leicestershire , were called to attend the incident at the building on stoke albany road at about 21:50 .
no-one was injured , but there was `` significant damage '' to property and it 's understood the incident involved a barn , farm machinery and tyres .
warren ellison , from the northamptonshire fire and rescue service , shared this from the scene on social media
@ twitterid and @ twitterid fighting this fire near desborough .
now under control but will be here a while .
# bettertogether
@ twitterid
